inlineContent.text: Offers many features for working with lines (presumably in a text view) including:
Parsing and evaluating lines, and their dependencies (via line references and variable declarations)
Notifying observers when dependent lines are evaluated
states. You can get a ticket (
) and jump back or forward to any states

topicSections.title: Convenience initializers for working with text views

abstract.text: Perform calculations across multiple lines
Comes with a single empty line (like a text editor)
Allow a range of numbers with no extra context to represent a date span
An optional list of variables that you would like to be used during parsing & evaluation
Set the content for a line subsheet in this line collection
Get the formatted definition of a particular varible defined in this line collection
Evaluates requested lines synchronously, and their dependencies asychronously (thus the callback).
Count of lines on the present page
Remove a line at a given line index
Searches downstream from a line index that the given line index contributes to
returns nil if there are no subtotals found
Sets the highlight color for a particular line in the line collection
Always 0
Add a new line to the line collection
Generate a variable that represents a collection of the results in this line collection
Which kinds of “comments” are supported by this line collection
Insert a new line with the specified expression at the given line index
A string that’s used as a “ticket” for traversing
states
Automatically creates and sets lines’ expressions to the lines in the given text
Move a line from one into to another index
Get a given line by index
Replace a line at a given line index
Generate a statistic (
) for a set of lines in the collection (with some options)
Removes the previously added observer from this line collection
Convert lines in the line collection to another locale
Batch multiple changes to the line collection into a single (undoable) action.
A special line reference that always point to the answer of the line directly above the line on which it’s used
Returns all the lines’ expressions in the LineCollection as a single new-line separated string
Text that includes multiple lines separated by newline characters
Allow a line to produce a unit definition
The syntax used is “1 moobean = 3 grams”
Sets the calculation behaviour for a particular line in the line collection
Update the expression of a line at a given index
Get the content for a subsheet in this line collection
Returns a tuple containing the underlying line sheet, and the evaluator type originally set during its creation
These formatting preferences will be used if the line doesn’t have explicit formatting preferences set
Sets the highlight color for a particular line in the line collection
All the types of statistics that SoulverCore supports
This method will return an average that includes subtotals, and will not respect skippage
Set to have lines’ expressions beautified with given options during parsing
Core model that backs a line collection
Returns a line collection with no lines, and a minimal customization
Overrides existing lines formatting/line-references, etc
Create a new line collection with a copy of the contents of this line collection.
A standard handler used by LineCollection for notifying observers which line indexes have been evaluated
An index set of all line indexes in this line collection
Doesn’t evaluate, just appends the the given line collection to this one
A basic model object representing an expression and result
Create a reference symbol for a line
Quickly get an array of lines at a set of indexes
Returns a string with a pure number value for this line, without any formatting or additional words
Insert a line below another line at a given index
A count of all lines that go into statistics, calculated synchronously
Insert a line object at the given index
like city = Sydney
Synchronously reparse and evaluate all lines in the collection
How many subsheets are in this line collection
“previous line”, “line above”, or “prev” in English
Add observers to be notified of evaluation, for example of dependent lines
This method will return a count that includes subtotals, and will not respect skippage
An average of all lines, calculated synchronously
Get a line via a line reference variable referring to this line
Check whether a given line reference refers to a valid lineIndex on a given line
An attribution string that may be displayed in a user interface for this line
Resets the line reference symbol for a line at the given index
like, “population of sydney = ?”
A basic encodable model object that contains a list of
objects
Sets the alignment for a particular line in the line collection
A set of line indexes whose results are still pending
Get a line by its reference
Similar to the NotificationCentre observer API
A powerful natural language calculation engine
Set a nil result for a pending line
Change the customization used by this line collection
True if every line in the collection has an empty string
Equivalent to the variable state produced by the last line of this line collection
Returns a variableList for a line at a given index
Perform calculations across multiple lines
The customization used for parsing and formatting lines
Is there a line in the collection at this index?
Sets the formatting for a particular line in the line collection
Are all indexes in this set present in the line collection?
Sets the formatting for every line in the line collection
A time dependent line is a line whose result depends on the current time (like where the expression is “now + 10 minutes”)
Rename keys with values in parsed expressions
This method will return a sum that includes subtotals, and will not respect skippage
Returns a tokenIndexPath for a given token
Designated initializer
The index of the last line in this collection
An array of lines in this line collection
Completes a batch change that was begun with a call to beginChanges(), performing evaluation and dependency updating as required
Indexes of lines in this collection that have a dependency on the given variables
This invalidates all tickets
Experimental feature, do not enable
A total of all lines, calculated synchronously
Returns a token for a given indexPath
Returns the first line above the given index that has a result
Experimental feature, do not enable
Get a line safely by a given index
Revert to a previous state of the line collection
Add variables that refer to the results of previous lines
Perform a set of changes to the line collection in a way that can be later undone
